verses.text: Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*, Where \add is\add* the bill of your motherâ€™s divorcement, whom I have put away? Or which of my creditors \add is it\add* to whom I have sold you? Behold, for your iniquities have you sold yourselves, And for your transgressions is your mother put away.

Wherefore, when I came, \add was there\add* no man? When I called, \add was there\add* none to answer? Is my hand shortened at all, that \add it\add* cannot redeem? Or have I no power to deliver? Behold, at my rebuke I dry up the sea, I make the rivers a wilderness: Their fish stinketh, because \add there is\add* no water, and dieth for thirst.
I clothe the heavens with blackness, And I make sackcloth their covering.

The Lord \sc God\sc* hath given me the tongue of the learned, That \add I\add* should know how to speak a word in season to \add him that is\add* weary: He wakeneth morning by morning, He wakeneth mine ear to hear as the learned.
The Lord \sc God\sc* hath opened mine ear, And I was not rebellious, Neither turned away back.
I gave my back to the smiters, And my cheeks to them that plucked off the hair: I hid not my face from shame and spitting.
For the Lord \sc God\sc* will help me; Therefore shall I not be confounded: Therefore have I set my face like a flint, And I know that I shall not be ashamed.
\add He is\add* near that justifieth me; Who will contend with me? let us stand together: Who \add is\add* mine adversary? let him come near to me.
Behold, the Lord \sc God\sc* will help me; Who \add is\add* he \add that\add* shall condemn me? Lo, they all shall wax old as a garment; the moth shall eat them up.

Who \add is\add* among you that feareth the \sc Lord\sc*, That obeyeth the voice of his servant, That walketh \add in\add* darkness, and hath no light? Let him trust in the name of the \sc Lord\sc*, And stay upon his God.

Behold, all ye that kindle a fire, that compass \add yourselves\add* about with sparks: Walk in the light of your fire, and in the sparks \add that\add* ye have kindled. This shall ye have of mine hand; Ye shall lie down in sorrow.
